message.content:
cs.SE, cs.AI, cs.SY, cs.HC, cs.CY. 

The paper discusses Requirements Engineering (RE) and its focus on eliciting, modelling, and analyzing the requirements and environment of a system-to-be in order to design its specification. This suggests that the paper is likely to belong to the Software Engineering (cs.SE) sub-category. Additionally, the paper discusses the design of the specification as a complex problem solving task, which involves decision making in new and ill-defined problem and solution spaces. This suggests that the paper may also belong to the Artificial Intelligence (cs.AI) sub-category. The paper also discusses the Requirements Problem for Adaptive Systems (RPAS), which suggests that it may belong to the Systems and Control (cs.SY) sub-category. Furthermore, the paper discusses the relationship between the Requirements Problem and mathematical optimization decision analysis and expected utility theory, which suggests that it may also belong to the Human-Computer Interaction (cs.HC) and Cybernetics (cs.CY) sub-categories.
